Fbs_example.cpp

This is an example of how to calculate and output the bootstrap current geometric factor for transport.
  P.Helander et al, Physics of Plasmas vol.18, 092505(2011)
  N.Nakajima et al, Nuclear Fusion, vol.29, 605(1989)
  V.Nemov et al, Plasma Pysics and Control Fusion, vol.46, 179(2004)

#include "../include/CStconfig.h"
#include <iostream>


//*********************************************************************
// The example calculates and prints  the bootstrap current geometric 
// factor for \f$1/\nu\f$ transport, using VMEC definition of minor 
// radius r=a*sqrt(s) with s being the normalized toroidal flux.  
int main(int argc, char* argv[])
{ 
  MConf::CStconfig mc("w7x-sc1.bc");
  if(!mc.isOK()) return 1;
  
  mc.truncate(1e-6); // truncate Bmn spectrum at level Bmn/B00 = 1e-6

  std::cout <<"#r/a         F_bs,%"<<std::endl;  
  std::cout.precision(3);
  std::cout.setf(std::ios::scientific);

  const int maxP = 30;

  for(int i=0; i<maxP; i++) {
    double x = 0.05+(0.975-0.05)*i/(maxP-1);    // x=sqrt(s)
    double s = x*x;
    std::cout<<x<<" "<<mc.FbsVmec(s)<<std::endl;
  }
  
  return 0;
}
